page.title: 04Summer (Visitors) Tourists
page.content: Thurso's Tourist Information Centre has been in operation for seven and a half years, firstly in the Town Hall and then down by the riverside. About 1500 people visit it every year,mostly in July and August. The Centre is open from April to October, 10.00 to 18.00 and from 09.00 to 19.00 in July and August. Tourists visit the area for the spectacular scenery and historic buildings, such as Old St. Peter's Church,the museums and the Meadow Well One museum is in the Town Library and the other, showing life in Thurso long ago, is beside the Town Hall. Most visitors come from the continent but the furthest travellers came from New Zealand. Sporting facilities offered are golf, river fishing, sea angling and surfing. For entertainment, visitors prefer music by Scottish Dance Bands.
